contributor: united states. army. corps of topographical engineers
description: Shows towns, roads, railroads, rivers, and houses with names of residents. Relief shown by hachures. Title derived from Stephenson's Civil War maps, 1989. Some sheets consist of two parts joined in the middle. Accompanied by index map (1 sheet ; 64 x 79 cm.) annotated in red ink to show sheet lines and numbers. Civil War salted paper maps. AL-7. LC Civil War maps (2nd ed.), 501.7 Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

contents: -- Sheet 8 (map 1). [Occoquan, Dumfries, Stafford C.H., and vicinity]. Ed. April 13th, 1864 (western half); Ed. April 18th, 1864 (eastern half) -- Sheet 8 (map 2). [Madison, C.H., Blue Ridge Mountains, Shenandoah River, and vicinity]. Ed. April 13th, 1864 (western half); Ed. April 19th, 1864 (eastern half) 2 copies, one of which is annotated in ink -- Sheet 11. April 6th, 1864, 2 copies, copy 1 annotated in red ink and pencil, marked to show the location of "Hd. Qrs, 1st Div., 5 Corps May 29 64" and copy 2 annotated in pencil  -- Sheet 16. [Hanover C.H., King William C.H., and vicinity]. Ed. May 2nd, 1864 (western half only) -- Sheet 17. [Palmyra C.H., Goochland C.H., and vicinity]. Ed. April 2nd, 1864 (western half); Ed. contributor: united states. army of the potomac. engineer department
united states. army of the potomac. office of surveys and maps
description: Shows towns, roads, railroads, rivers, and houses with names of residents. Relief shown by hachures. Title derived from R.W. Stephenson's: Civil War maps, 2nd ed., 1989. Sheets are unnumbered and untitled. Some sheets are mounted on cloth backing and are torn in margins with holes and water stains throughout. The sheet covering the environs of Dumfries, Acquia, and Stafford is marked "Proof sheet issued June 12th 1863 Hd. Qr. Army of the Potomac, Engineers Department"; the sheet covering the Warrenton and Bristoe Station area is marked "Office of Surveys and Maps for the Army of the Potomac, 78 Winder's Building, Sept. 15th 1863." Sheets covering Culpeper C.H. and vicinity, ed. Nov. 10, 1863, and Morrisville, Tackett's Mill, and vicinity, ed. Nov. 12, 1863 Gift; Summit Enterprises; June 2003. LC Civil War maps (2nd ed.), 483.5 Available also through the Library of Congress web site as raster image.

contents: [Richmond City district map] (Scale 1:60,000) -- [Fredericksburg and vicinity] -- [Fredericksburg, Spottsylvania C.H., Stafford C.H., and vicinity, wooded area map] -- [Spottsylvania C.H. and vicinity] proof sheet of country between Dumfries, Fredericksburg, and Spotsylvania C.H. (Lith.) -- [Spottsylvania C.H. and vicinity] -- [Morrisville, Tackett's Mill, and vicinity, wooded area map] -- [Morrisville, Tackett's Mill, and vicinity] -- [Morrisville, Tackett's Mill, and vicinity] Ed. Nov. 12th 1863 / Lith. by J.F. Gedney, Washington DC -- [Warrenton, Brentville, and vicinity] / Office of Surveys and Maps for the Army of the Potomac, 78 Winder's Building, Sept. 15th 1863, annotated in pencil -- [Culpepper C.H. and vicinity] annotated in pencil -- [Culpepper C.H. and vicinity] Ed. Nov. 10, 1863, annotated in red ink and pencil -- [Dumfries, Acquia, Stafford C.H., and vicinity] proof sheet issued June 12th 1863 Hd. Qr. Army of the Potomac, Engineers Department -- [Dumfries, Acquia, Stafford C.H., and vicinity] -- [Manassas Sta., Occoquan, and vicinity] -- [Leesburg, Middleburg, Salem, and vicinity].
contributors: United States. Army of the Potomac. Engineer Department.

contributor: united states. corps of topographical engineers
description: Relief shown by hachures. Depths shown by soundings. Shows forts and batteries in the District of Columbia and immediate vicinity. At head of title: Surveys for military defences. LC copy annotated in black ink and colored inks to show troop positions and engagements. Annotated in black ink on verso: Major General Sigel to Colonel L.P. di Cesnola, Chantilly, Novbr. 1862. Bookplate of "Palma di Cesnola" mounted on verso. Includes "Data used in compilation," table of "Elevations above tide water," and "Geological profile of Loudoun County." LC Civil War maps (2nd ed.) 467 Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Call no. cited in LC Civil War maps (2nd ed.): G3882.N6S5 1862 .U5 Vault. Vault DCP ARP

call_number: G3881.S5 1862 .U51 Vault : CW 467 Copy 2 not dissected and lacks covers; annotated in black ink to show the following forts in vicinity of Washington, D.C.: De Russy, Slemmer, Thayer, Davis, Baker, Wagner, Riketts [i.e. Ricketts], and Snyder; the name of Fort Towson printed on the map altered in black ink to show Fort Totten; annotated in black ink at head of title "211, L. Sheet 1"; annotated in black ink below title "Transf'd from Office of Chf. Engr. Defenses of Washington, to Engr. Dept. J[a]ny 1866."
contributors: United States. Corps of Topographical Engineers.
medium: 1 map on 4 sheets : dissected and mounted on linen ; 166 x 125 cm., sheets 84 x 63 cm. and 83 x 63 cm., folded in covers 17 x 10 cm.
notes: Relief shown by hachures. Depths shown by soundings.
Shows forts and batteries in the District of Columbia and immediate vicinity.
At head of title: Surveys for military defences.

LC copy annotated in black ink and colored inks to show troop positions and engagements. Annotated in black ink on verso: Major General Sigel to Colonel L.P. di Cesnola, Chantilly, Novbr. 1862. Bookplate of "Palma di Cesnola" mounted on verso.
Includes "Data used in compilation," table of "Elevations above tide water," and "Geological profile of Loudoun County."
LC Civil War maps (2nd ed.) 467

contributor: united states. corps of topographical engineers
description: Relief shown by hachures. Depths shown by soundings. Shows forts and batteries in the District of Columbia and immediate vicinity. Also shows "Battle field at Bull Run fought July 21st 1861." At head of title: Surveys for military defences. "Additions & corrections for Rappahannock and Rapid Ann Rivers and their vicinity ..." added to data used in compilation. Mounted on cloth backing. Includes "Data used in compilation," table of "Elevations above tide water," and "Geological profile of Loudoun County." LC Civil War maps (2nd ed.) 469 Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Copy 1, northwestern and northeastern sheets dissected and mounted on linen, folded in covers (17 x 11 cm.); southwestern and southeastern sheets not dissected and lack covers. Copy 2, northeastern sheet dissected and mounted on linen, folded in covers (17 x 11 cm.); northwestern and southwestern not dissected and lack covers; southeastern sheet missing. Vault DCP ARP
